metadata.title: USN-6947-1 -- Kerberos vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that Kerberos incorrectly handled GSS message tokens where an unwrapped token could appear to be truncated. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2024-37370)  It was discovered that Kerberos incorrectly handled GSS message tokens when sent a token with invalid length fields. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2024-37371)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6947-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  krb5-admin-server - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm5 krb5-doc - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm5 krb5-gss-samples - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm5 krb5-kdc - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm5 krb5-kdc-ldap - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm5 krb5-locales - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm5 krb5-multidev - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm5 krb5-otp - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm5 krb5-pkinit - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm5 krb5-user - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm5 libgssapi-krb5-2 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm5 libgssrpc4 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm5 libk5crypto3 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm5 libkadm5clnt-mit9 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm5 libkadm5srv-mit8 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm5 libkadm5srv-mit9 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm5 libkdb5-7 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm5 libkrad-dev - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm5 libkrad0 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm5 libkrb5-3 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm5 libkrb5-dev - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm5 libkrb5support0 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm5 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
